intro: Diasperus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has a slender, herbaceous stem with alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Diasperus micranthus produces small, usually yellow or greenish pods that contain several seeds.
